analysis: The documents all pertain to the establishment and function of Presidential advisory committees or commissions. These committees are formed to address specific issues, ranging from employment of the handicapped and ethical problems in medicine to women's equality, international athletics, federalism policy, aviation policies, community service, juvenile delinquency, national security telecommunications, and US-Japan relations. The committees are composed of members appointed by the President, often including representatives from various government agencies and private citizens with relevant expertise. They advise the President on policy, conduct studies, and coordinate activities related to their respective areas of focus. Many of these committees operate under the Federal Advisory Committee Act.
title: Presidential Advisory Committees for Policy and Public Welfare
